raw: * Base class for all unit tests.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Base class for all unit tests.

raw: * This event can be fired by assertion functions instead of throwing a
* {@link qx.core.AssertionError}, ensuring that any code defined after the
* assertion call will still run.
* Event data: The {@link qx.core.AssertionError}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event can be fired by assertion functions instead of throwing a {@link qx.core.AssertionError}, ensuring that any code defined after the assertion call will still run. Event data: The {@link qx.core.AssertionError}

raw: * Instruct the test to wait. Used for asynchronous tests.
* @param delay {Integer?5000} Amount of time in milliseconds to wait.
* @param deferredFunction {Function?false} Optional function to run after
* timeout has expired.
* @param context {Object?window} Optional execution context for
* deferredFunction

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Instruct the test to wait. Used for asynchronous tests.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: delay {Integer?5000} Amount of time in milliseconds to wait.
@param.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to wait.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
deferredFunction {Function?false} Optional function to run after
 timeout has expired.
@param.description:
Optional function to run after
 timeout has expired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {Object?window} Optional execution context for
 deferredFunction
@param.description:
Optional execution context for
 deferredFunction

raw: * Cancel a timeout started with wait() and run the given
* function. Used for asynchronous tests, e.g. in a listener's callback
* function.
* *Important*
* The used *deferredFunction* is the last function which is executed before
* the whole test case is disposed. But you are able to use a new
* wait() / resume() pair in the call sequence of the deferred function.
* @param deferredFunction {Function?} Function to run
* @param self {Object?} reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
* callback. By default the test instance is used.
* @return {var} The return value of the deferred function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Cancel a timeout started with wait() and run the given function. Used for asynchronous tests, e.g. in a listener's callback function. Important The used deferredFunction is the last function which is executed before the whole test case is disposed. But you are able to use a new wait() / resume() pair in the call sequence of the deferred function.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: deferredFunction {Function?} Function to run
@param.description: Function to run

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object?} reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
 callback. By default the test instance is used.
@param.description:
reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
 callback. By default the test instance is used.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the deferred function
@return.description: The return value of the deferred function

raw: * Cancel a timeout started with wait() in setUp() and run the test
* function. Used for asynchronous setUp of tests.
* @return {var} The return value of the testRun

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Cancel a timeout started with wait() in setUp() and run the test function. Used for asynchronous setUp of tests.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the testRun
@return.description: The return value of the testRun

raw: * Cancel a timeout started with wait() and return a function,
* which calls {@link #resume}. This function is useful
* to wrap an event handler or callback function within the resume call sequence.
* It provides the deferred function with all parameters from original caller.
*<pre>
* obj.addListener("appear", this.resumeHandler(function(e){
*   // do some nice
* this.wait();
*
* @param deferredFunction {Function} Function to run as event handler or callback
* @param self {Object?} reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
*        callback. By default the test instance is used.
* @return {Function} Wrapper function which runs resume with deferred function

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Cancel a timeout started with wait() and return a function, which calls {@link #resume}. This function is useful to wrap an event handler or callback function within the resume call sequence. It provides the deferred function with all parameters from original caller.

 obj.addListener("appear", this.resumeHandler(function(e){

 }));
 this.wait();

@param.name: @param
@param.body: deferredFunction {Function} Function to run as event handler or callback
@param.description: Function to run as event handler or callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object?} reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
        callback. By default the test instance is used.
@param.description:
reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
        callback. By default the test instance is used.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Function} Wrapper function which runs resume with deferred function
@return.description: Wrapper function which runs resume with deferred function

raw: * Skip this test. Any code after a call to this method will not be executed.

raw: * Assert that an event is fired.

*   fires the event.

*   listener. The function has one parameter called e which is the event.

   fires the event.

@param.body:
listener {Function?null} The function which will be invoked in the

raw: * Assert that the value has the given type using the typeof
* operator. Because the type is not always what it is supposed to be it is
* better to use more explicit checks like {@link #assertString} or
* {@link #assertArray}.
* @param value {var} Value to check
* @param type {String} expected type of the value
* @param msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the value has the given type using the typeof operator. Because the type is not always what it is supposed to be it is better to use more explicit checks like {@link #assertString} or {@link #assertArray}.

@param.description: Value to check

@param.body: type {String} expected type of the value
@param.description: expected type of the value
